intro: Diplusodon adpressipilus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical structure reflects its role as a hardy, drought-tolerant species in its native habitat.
